spanish: Pareces estúpido.
english: You look stupid.

spanish: Creo que él tiene razón.
english: I think he's right.

spanish: Ella parece una profesora.
english: She looks like a teacher.

spanish: Ella se parece a su tía.
english: She looks like her aunt.

spanish: Parece que Tom ganó la carrera.
finnish: Näyttää siltä, että Tom voitti sen kilpailun.
english: It looks like Tom won the race.

spanish: Te creo.
english: I believe you.

spanish: Lo siento, no tengo suelto.
english: I'm sorry, I don't have change.

spanish: Ella no es tan joven como parece.
finnish: Tyttö ei ole niin nuori miltä näyttää.
english: She is not as young as she looks.

spanish: Ella parece joven, pero de hecho tiene más de cuarenta años.
finnish: Hän näyttää nuorelta, mutta itse asiassa hän on yli neljäkymmentävuotias.
english: She looks young. But actually, she's over forty.

spanish: El perro parece hambriento.
english: The dog looks hungry.

spanish: Hoy me siento mucho mejor.
english: Today, I am feeling a lot better.

spanish: Nancy parece cansada.
english: Nancy looks tired.

spanish: Ken parece una persona simpática.
english: Ken appears to be a friendly person.

spanish: Él parece cansado.
english: He seems tired.

spanish: Lo siento, se me olvidó hacer los deberes.
english: I'm sorry, I forgot to do my homework.

spanish: Pienso en ti todo el tiempo.
english: I think of you all the time.

spanish: El Sr. White parece tener muchos amigos.
finnish: Herra Whitella vaikuttaa olevan paljon ystäviä.
english: Mr White seems to have many friends.

spanish: Pareces cansado.
english: You look tired.

spanish: Creo que tienes razón.
english: I think that you're right.

spanish: Pareces enfermo.
english: You look sick.

spanish: Creo que lo entiendo.
english: I think I understand.

spanish: Todas las casas en esta vecindad se parecen tanto que no las puedo distinguir.
finnish: Kaikki tämän asuinalueen talot näyttävät niin samanlaisilta, että en erota niitä toisistaan.
english: All the houses in this neighborhood look so much alike that I can't tell them apart.

spanish: Jack se parece a su padre.
english: Jack resembles his father.

spanish: La abuela de Tom parece estar sana.
english: Tom's grandmother looks healthy.

spanish: Hoy me siento peor que ayer.
english: I feel worse today than I did yesterday.

spanish: Pareces cansada.
english: You seem tired.

spanish: Mi hermana se parece a mi abuela.
english: My sister resembles my grandmother.

spanish: Me siento vivo.
english: I feel alive.

spanish: Me siento viva.
english: I feel alive.

spanish: Me parece que esto está demasiado caro.
finnish: Minusta näyttää, että tämä on liian kallista.
english: It seems to me that this is too expensive.

spanish: Me parece que esto es demasiado caro.
finnish: Minusta näyttää, että tämä on liian kallista.
english: It seems to me that this is too expensive.

spanish: Este libro parece interesante.
english: This book looks interesting.

spanish: Creo que Japón es un país muy seguro.
finnish: Minusta Japani on todella turvallinen maa.
english: I think that Japan is a very safe country.

spanish: Parece que Jane está disfrutando de la fiesta.
english: Jane appears to be enjoying the party.

spanish: Mi hermano se parece mucho a mí.
finnish: Veljeni on todella samannäköinen kuin minä.
english: My brother looks very similar to me.

spanish: Lo siento.
english: Sorry...

spanish: Creo que él estaba enojado.
english: I think he was angry.

spanish: Pareces realmente cansado.
english: You look like you're really tired.

spanish: Tus oes parecen aes.
english: Your o's look like a's.

spanish: Creo que tiene cuarenta años.
finnish: Luulen, että hän on neljäkymmentä vuotta.
english: I believe she's 40 years old.

spanish: Me siento aliviado después de haber dicho todo lo que quería decir.
finnish: Minulla on helpottunut olo, kun sain sanottua kaiken, minkä halusin sanoa.
english: I feel relieved after having said all that I wanted to say.

spanish: En mi opinión, el esperanto es muy difícil.
english: In my opinion, Esperanto is very difficult.

spanish: Yo considero a los obstáculos como un desafío.
english: I see obstacles as challenges.

spanish: Creo que me voy a quedar aquí.
english: I think I'm going to stay here.

spanish: Hoy en día, me siento mucho mejor.
english: Today, I am feeling a lot better.

spanish: Ella parece triste.
english: She looks sad.

spanish: ¡Creo que todavía estamos en Polonia!
english: I think we are still in Poland!

spanish: Parece que pasó algo.
finnish: Vaikuttaa siltä, että jotain on tapahtunut.
english: It seems that something has happened.

spanish: Parece que ha ocurrido algo.
finnish: Vaikuttaa siltä, että jotain on tapahtunut.
english: It seems that something has happened.

spanish: Él parece fuerte.
english: He looks strong.

spanish: Tom no quiere parecer débil.
english: Tom doesn't want to appear weak.

spanish: Parece buena persona.
english: He seems like a good person.

spanish: Él parece haber sido rico.
english: He seems to have been rich.

spanish: Creo que entiendo.
english: I think I understand.

spanish: Creo que la historia es cierta.
english: I believe that the story is true.

spanish: Tom parece ser muy feliz.
english: Tom seems very happy.

spanish: Creo que eres la mujer que he estado esperando toda mi vida.
finnish: Luulen että olet nainen jota olen odottanut koko ikäni.
english: I think you're the woman I've been waiting for all my life.

spanish: Mi reloj parece estar roto.
english: My clock seems to be broken.

spanish: Tom parece estar muy contento.
english: Tom looks very happy.

spanish: Parece muy interesante.
english: It seems very interesting.

spanish: Parece que tengo que el número incorrecto.
finnish: Vaikuttaa siltä, että minulla on väärä numero.
english: I seem to have the wrong number.

spanish: Vuestro padre parece muy amable.
english: Your father seems very nice.

spanish: No creo que su historia sea cierta.
finnish: En usko, että hänen tarinansa on totta.
english: I don't think his story is true.

spanish: Creo que me compraré un coche nuevo.
english: I think I'll buy a new car.

spanish: Pienso en ti cada vez que me cepillo mis dientes.
finnish: Ajattelen sinua joka kerta, kun harjaan hampaani.
english: I think about you every time I brush my teeth.

spanish: Pienso que mi novio husmea en mi correo.
english: I think my boyfriend is spying on my emails.

spanish: Pienso que mi novio me espía mi correo.
english: I think my boyfriend is spying on my emails.

spanish: Creo que sí.
english: I think so.

spanish: Parecen fotografías.
english: They seem to be photographs.

spanish: Parece que mucha gente no sabe la diferencia entre "their" y "they're".
finnish: Vaikuttaa siltä, että monet ihmiset eivät tiedä mitä eroa on sanoilla ”their” ja ”they're”.
english: It seems that many people don't know the difference between "their" and "they're".

spanish: Parece que mucha gente no sabe la diferencia entre "then" y "than".
finnish: Vaikuttaa siltä, että monet ihmiset eivät tiedä mitä eroa on sanoilla ”then” ja ”than”.
english: It seems that many people don't know the difference between "then" and "than".

spanish: Parece que mucha gente no sabe la diferencia entre "loose" y "lose".
finnish: Näyttää siltä, että monet eivät tiedä mitä eroa on sanoilla ”loose” ja ”lose”.
english: It seems that many people don't know the difference between "loose" and "lose".

spanish: A menudo pienso en ti.
english: I often think about you.

spanish: Parece que Mary está borracha otra vez.
finnish: Vaikuttaa siltä, että Mary on taas humalassa.
english: It looks like Mary is drunk again.

spanish: Siento que algo anda mal.
english: I feel that something is wrong.

spanish: Tom parece estar dormido.
english: Tom seems to be asleep.

spanish: Creo que entiende de qué hablo.
english: I think you know what I mean.

spanish: Parece ser un estudiante.
finnish: Näyttää siltä, että hän on opiskelija.
english: He seems to be a student.

spanish: Supongo que deberíamos irnos ahora.
english: I guess we should leave now.

spanish: En mi opinión, él tiene razón.
english: In my opinion, he is correct.

spanish: Nada es como parece.
english: Nothing is as it seems.

spanish: Parece que Tony se compró un auto costoso.
finnish: Vaikuttaa siltä, että Toni osti kalliin auton.
english: It seems that Tony bought an expensive car.

spanish: Hoy me siento mal.
english: I feel bad today.

spanish: Creo que se trata de un Picasso auténtico.
finnish: Luulen että se on aito Picasso.
english: I believe it is a genuine Picasso.

spanish: Tom se parece a su padre.
english: Tom resembles his father.

spanish: Tom parece enfermo.
english: Tom looks sick.

spanish: Pienso que es demasiado joven.
finnish: Luulen, että hän on liian nuori.
english: I think she's too young.

spanish: Me siento enfermo.
english: I'm feeling sick.

spanish: Mhmm. Yo también pienso que sí.
english: Mm-hm. I think so too.

spanish: Ahora me siento mucho mejor.
finnish: Nyt minulla on paljon parempi olo.
english: I feel a lot better now.

spanish: Tom parece triste.
english: Tom looks sad.

spanish: Parece nieve.
english: It looks like snow.

spanish: Lo siento, se me olvidó.
english: Sorry, I forgot.

spanish: No creo que sea verdad.
finnish: En usko, että se on totta.
english: I don't think it's true.

spanish: No pareces muy feliz de verme.
finnish: Et vaikuta kovin iloiselta nähdessäsi minut.
english: You don't seem too happy to see me.

spanish: No importa lo que digas, no cambiaré de parecer.
finnish: Aivan sama mitä sanot, minä en muuta mieltäni.
english: No matter what you say, I won't change my mind.

spanish: No creo que nadie notara lo que hiciste.
finnish: En usko, että kukaan huomasi mitä teit.
english: I don't think anyone noticed what you did.

spanish: Creo que deberías decírselo a Tom.
finnish: Minusta sinun pitäisi sanoa se Tomille.
english: I think you should tell Tom that.

spanish: Parece que ella está borracha.
english: She looks as if she were drunk.

spanish: No creo que entiendas del todo las consecuencias.
finnish: En luule, että täysin ymmärrät seuraukset.
english: I don't think you fully understand the consequences.

spanish: Creo que ese libro está en la biblioteca.
finnish: Luulen, että se kirja löytyy kirjastosta.
english: I think that book is in the library.

spanish: Me siento tan sola.
english: I feel so lonely.

spanish: No creo que acabas de decir eso.
finnish: En usko että sanoit sen juuri.
english: I don't believe you just said that.

spanish: Creo que deberías decirle eso a Tom.
finnish: Minusta sinun pitäisi sanoa se Tomille.
english: I think you should tell Tom that.

spanish: Yo pienso que la comida en Japón es cara.
english: I think food is expensive in Japan.

spanish: Yo creo que a la sopa le falta un poco de sal.
english: I think the soup needs a bit of salt.

spanish: Creo que veo el problema.
english: I think I see the problem.

spanish: Yo no me creo todo lo que Tom dice.
finnish: En usko kaikkea, mitä Tom sanoo.
english: I don't believe everything Tom says.

spanish: ¡Parece que ahora hay más de dos mil frases en uigur en Tatoeba!
finnish: Näyttää siltä, että Tatoebassa on nyt yli kaksituhatta uiguurinkielistä lausetta!
english: It looks like there are now over two thousand Uyghur sentences on Tatoeba!

spanish: Lo siento, olvidé tu nombre.
english: I'm sorry, I forgot your name.

spanish: Pienso en ello de vez en cuando.
english: I think about that from time to time.

spanish: No creo que ellos sean profesores.
english: I don't think they're teachers.

spanish: No creo que eso sea sabio.
english: I don't think that's wise.

spanish: No creo que eso sea cierto.
finnish: En usko, että se on totta.
english: I don't believe that to be true.

spanish: No creo que eso sea posible.
english: I don't think that's possible.

spanish: No creo que sea necesario.
english: I don't think that's necessary.

spanish: Tom es mayor de lo que parece.
finnish: Tom on vanhempi kuin miltä näyttää.
english: Tom is older than he looks.

spanish: Él parece nunca envejecer.
english: He never seems to be any older.

spanish: Ese parece ser el problema.
english: That seems to be the problem.

spanish: Tom parece ser incapaz de interactuar normalmente con otras personas.
finnish: Vaikuttaa siltä, että Tom ei pysty toimimaan normaalisti muiden ihmisten kanssa.
english: Tom seems to be unable to interact normally with other people.

spanish: Tom parece estar un poco nervioso.
english: Tom appears to be a bit nervous.

spanish: Tom parece estar un poco preocupado.
english: Tom appears to be a bit worried.

spanish: Tom parece ser más amistoso que antes.
english: Tom seems friendlier than before.

spanish: Creo que tengo un poco de fiebre.
finnish: Luulen että minulla on hienoinen kuume.
english: I think I've got a touch of fever.

spanish: Parece que Tanaka pasó su examen.
english: It seems Tanaka passed her exam.

spanish: Yo pienso que deberías tomarte un descanso; te ves enferma.
finnish: Minusta sinun pitäisi levätä. Näytät sairaalta.
english: I think you'd better take a rest; you look ill.

spanish: No creo que estés loco.
english: I don't think you're crazy.

spanish: No creo en los extraterrestres.
english: I don't believe in aliens.

spanish: No creo haber infringido alguna ley.
english: I don't think I've broken any laws.

spanish: Creo que ella está fingiendo.
english: I think she's faking.

spanish: Creo que él está fingiendo.
english: I think he's faking.

spanish: No creo que esté fingiendo.
english: I don't think he's faking.

spanish: No creo que haya hecho suficiente espagueti para todos.
finnish: En usko, että olen tehnyt tarpeeksi spaghettia kaikille.
english: I don't think I've made enough spaghetti for everyone.

spanish: Tom se levantó de su asiento.
english: Tom got up from his seat.

spanish: Tú quieres que consiga un mejor trabajo, pero no creo que pueda.
finnish: Haluat, että hankin paremman työn, mutta en usko, että voin.
english: You want me to get a better job, but I don't think I can.

spanish: Todo parece confuso.
english: Everything seems confusing.

spanish: No creo que en realidad podamos decir que uno esté bien y el otro esté mal.
finnish: En usko, että voimme oikeastaan sanoa toisen olleen oikeassa ja toisen väärässä.
english: I don't think we can really say that one is right and the other is wrong.

spanish: Yo pienso que es medio estúpido.
english: I think it's kind of stupid.

spanish: Creo que hay alguien ahí afuera.
finnish: Luulen, että tuolla ulkona on joku.
english: I think there's someone out there.

spanish: Tom estudia todo el tiempo, pero jamás parece aprender nada.
finnish: Tom opiskelee koko ajan, mutta ei tunnu ikinä oppivan mitään.
english: Tom is always studying, but he never seems to learn anything.

spanish: Vuelve a tu asiento.
english: Go back to your seat.

spanish: Creo que se puede vencer a Tom.
english: I think Tom can be beaten.

spanish: Creo que es muy improbable que Tom aparezca hoy.
finnish: Luulen, että on erittäin epätodennäköistä, että Tom ilmaantuu paikalle tänään.
english: I think it's highly unlikely that Tom will show up today.

spanish: Creo que Tom podría estar enojado conmigo.
finnish: Luulen, että Tom saattaa olla vihainen minulle.
english: I think Tom might be mad at me.

spanish: Lo considero mi deber.
english: I consider it my duty.

spanish: En mi opinión, no es importante.
finnish: Minun mielestäni se ei ole tärkeää.
english: In my opinion, it's not important.

spanish: Creo que tienes gripe.
english: I think you've got the flu.

spanish: Yo pienso que deberías tener cuidado.
english: I think you should be careful.

spanish: Pareces ser un hombre honesto.
english: You seem to be an honest man.

spanish: Parece que Tom quiere hablar contigo.
finnish: Tom näyttää siltä, että hän haluaa puhua kanssasi.
english: It seems like Tom wants to talk to you.

spanish: Yo pienso que es demasiado arriesgado.
english: I think it's too risky.

spanish: No creo que nadie notara lo que hicimos.
finnish: En usko, että kukaan huomasi mitä me teimme.
english: I don't think anyone noticed what we did.

spanish: Tom parece estar enojado.
english: Tom looks angry.

spanish: Parece ser una cámara de algún tipo.
english: It looks like a camera of some kind.

spanish: Todos parecen ser optimistas.
english: Everyone seems optimistic.

spanish: Creo que estás siendo un poco muy cuidadoso.
finnish: Luulen että olet hieman liian varovainen.
english: I think you're being a little too careful.

spanish: Me siento como un extraño.
english: I feel like an outsider.

spanish: ¡Lo siento!
english: Sorry!

spanish: Parece que estás de mal humor esta mañana.
finnish: Vaikuttaa siltä, että olet huonolla tuulella tänä aamuna.
english: It seems like you're in a bad mood this morning.

spanish: Parece que falta algo.
english: Something seems to be missing.

spanish: Tom parece estar siempre de mal humor.
finnish: Tomi näyttää olevan aina huonolla tuulella.
english: Tom always seems to be in a bad mood.

spanish: Pienso que llevará tiempo.
finnish: Mä luulen, et siihen menee aikaa.
english: I think it's going to take time.

spanish: No pareces muy satisfecho.
english: You don't seem very satisfied.

spanish: Pareces estar aburrido.
finnish: Näyttää siltä, että sinulla on tylsää.
english: You seem to be bored.

spanish: Pareces estar bebido.
english: You seem to be drunk.

spanish: Encontré tu cartera en el asiento trasero de mi coche.
finnish: Mä löysin sun lompakon mun auton takapenkiltä.
english: I found your wallet on the backseat of my car.

spanish: No parece tan difícil como antes.
finnish: Se ei vaikuta yhtä vaikealta kuin ennen.
english: It doesn't seem as difficult as before.

spanish: Creo que deberías añadir un poco más de pimienta.
finnish: Minusta sinun pitäisi lisätä hieman pippuria.
english: I think that you should add a little more pepper.

spanish: Creo que Tomás está loco.
finnish: Mä luulen, et Tomi on tullu hulluksi.
english: I think that Tom is crazy.

spanish: Creo que deberías pedir perdón.
english: I think you should apologize.

spanish: Me siento tan estúpido.
english: I feel so stupid.
